snippet: The poor and minorities remain vulnerable to accidents involving toxic materials. Therefore, the E.P.A. should strengthen regulations.
abstract: Editorial contends explosion at fertilizer plant in West, Tex, in April highlighted glaring shortcomings in federal and state regulation of facilities that produce, store and use toxic chemicals; warns that poor and minorities are particularly vulnerable to health risks from facilities using hazardous materials; calls on Environmental Protection Agency to take action.
lead_paragraph: The poor and minorities remain vulnerable to accidents involving toxic materials. Therefore, the E.P.A. should strengthen regulations.

headline.seo: A Failure to Police Chemical Plants
